name: NewYorker
text:
Not all novels should be, or could be, as playful as this one, Dave Eggers writes, "but it wouldn’t hurt to have a few more that allow humans—characters, readers, authors even—to laugh."
https://t.co/nZcZM6XlxG

name: NewYorker
text:
Craig Atkinson’s 2016 documentary film “Do Not Resist” traces the transformation of U.S. police departments into forces that often look and act like our Army and Marines.
https://t.co/K7gMQrZirJ

name: NewYorker
text: On Friday, Mayor de Blasio answered questions about the N.Y.P.D. response to the protests on “The Brian Lehrer Show.” It was a 30-minute performance of defensiveness, denial, and bizarre false equivalence. https://t.co/YTiDnr6IJr

name: NewYorker
text: In the years after her mother and eight other members of the Emanuel A.M.E. Church were murdered by a white supremacist, Reverend Sharon Risher rose above her doubts in humanity to become an activist against gun violence. https://t.co/0PEn2iGZ2S

name: NewYorker
text:
It’s only at the end of @MeghaMaj’s brief, brave first novel that the reader becomes fully aware of how broad its judgments are, how fierce and absolute its condemnations.
https://t.co/lOmElYn694

name: NewYorker
text: Much of the writing in Samantha Harvey’s new memoir, about her year-long struggle with insomnia, mirrors the deranged logic of the sleep-starved brain. https://t.co/n3mywhqaQR
